Player 6\'s claim, though not entirely confirmed, led to Player 1\'s elimination, which could be seen as a slight validation of their seer role. Rule [5] highlights behavior inconsistency as a potential indicator of one’s role, and Player 4\'s initial silence followed by a defensive stance fits this rule. Rule [7] reflects on the targeting of critical roles like the seer, hinting at a possible werewolf tactic; since Player 6 died shortly after claiming to be the seer and pointing out Player 1, who was then eliminated, this adds to the suspicion against Player 4, who voted for Player 6 and has not drawn much attention until now.\n\nPlayer 5 has pinpointed similar concerns and seems aligned with this course of action, validating my decision through their medic role\'s perspective. Player 0, who has shown analytical skills and urged for cautious decision-making, may nonetheless find my voting rationale consistent with the evidence at hand. They have also expressed suspicion towards Player 4.\n\nThe result of the vote could possibly lead to the elimination of Player 4 if other players share similar suspicions and have observed the same behavior patterns. This could strengthen my perceived role as a diligent villager who is actively participating in protecting the village.\n\nOn the other hand, if my actions result in the elimination of a fellow villager, it would force me to reassess my strategy and the information I\'ve deemed credible. It might also make other players question my judgment and potentially shift the suspicion onto me. However, my adherence to the strategy and my alignment with other players\' logical assessments should minimize this risk.\nCase 2: Vote for Player 5. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 5, I think these things would happen:\n\nGiven that Player 5 has been proactive in their role and has been consistent in their behavior, aiming to align with what we\'d expect from the medic, my vote against Player 5 may not align with the logical flow of the game and the information presented thus far. Other players, particularly Player 0, who has shown a tendency to analyze situations before making decisions, might question my judgment. They may suspect that my decision to vote for Player 5, who has been actively participating and has logically suspected Player 4, indicates that I am not following the collective goal of villagers—to identify and vote out werewolves.\n\nThe result of the vote could lead to confusion within the village, as the majority of suspicion has been cast toward Player 4. If Player 5 is voted out and turns out to be the medic, as suspected, it would cast doubt on my motives and align with rule [7] as it could be seen as targeting critical village roles, thereby making me a potential suspect in future rounds. It would also decrease village safety, as an important role would be removed based on my vote, which does not align with the credible information at hand.\n\nVoting for Player 5 goes against several items in my strategy that suggest weighing evidence, patterns of elimination, and the credibility of claims. Without significant evidence against Player 5, advocating for their elimination could be perceived as an attempt to divert attention from more suspicious players and could imply I have ulterior motives, impeding my credibility going forward.\n\nIf Player 5 is not voted out and survives, they may hold suspicion toward me, wondering why I voted against the logical evidence brought forward in the game, particularly their own actions, which have been attributed to those of the medic.\n\nAs a result, while I am tasked with following my strategy, considering to vote for Player 5 does not align with my specified rules and would not only potentially harm the village but would very likely cast suspicion upon myself that may lead to my own scrutiny and possible elimination in future rounds.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

By casting suspicion on them, I might deflect attention from both of us and protect the werewolf team. Additionally, if Player 6 is indeed the seer, it is in our best interest to eliminate them early on to prevent them from revealing more werewolves in the future rounds.\nEvent: Player 1 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 1 died.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 5 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Given the unfortunate demise of Player 6, who claimed to be the seer and pointed to Player 1 as a werewolf, it\'s logical to consider the likelihood of Player 4\'s involvement, as they were untouched by the seer\'s claim. Player 4\'s generic statements earlier do not alleviate suspicion. I have performed my duty as medic, aiming to protect those who might be targeted by the werewolves based on logical deductions. It\'s imperative we scrutinize Player 4\'s actions and assess their alignment with the village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Player 4 has been silent since the seer\'s accusation and subsequent death. Despite the seer targeting Player 1, who was voted out, Player 4\'s subtle approach and undisturbed status merit suspicion. Player 5, who claims to be the medic, has actively participated and pinpointed concerns, while Player 4\'s input was generic. This pattern is concerning; it could indicate a strategic silence to avoid detection. Given these observations, we should closely examine Player 4\'s actions and consider them a candidate for our vote."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Considering the unfortunate death of Player 6, who claimed the seer\'s role, and the subsequent absence of suspicion on Player 4, I voice my concerns regarding Player 4\'s behavior. They have remained silent since the accusations, offering no defense or contribution to our discussions. This pattern stands in stark contrast to the proactivity shown by Player 5, whose actions are consistent with what we would expect from the medic. Player 0 has been analytical and cautious, not quick to judge without substantiated evidence. In light of these observations and our shared objective to protect the village, we must scrutinize Player 4\'s silence following the seer\'s accusation and consider it a significant factor as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, my silence was borne from shock and reflection, not guilt. I voted Player 6 not because of their seer claim, but due to the possibility of falsifying that role to sow discord. My earlier generic statement was an attempt to not seem overzealous, which often backfires. I recognize the suspicion on me yet I assure you, I stand with the village. We must focus on behaviors and patterns, not just words. I urge us to think carefully; our survival depends on unity and clear judgment."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to choose a player to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nI vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is: <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your answer based on the above requirements.'}]

[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'You are player 5, and in this game you are a medic.\nIt is round 1. All players currently alive are: [0, 3, 4, 5], which indicates that [2, 1, 6] are dead.\nYou haven\'t tried to heal anyone yet.\n\nThese are ALL events before:\n\nEvent: Game starts.\nEvent: Round 1 begins.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 1. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 1. My reason is that, given my role strategy rule [0], I should attempt to predict the werewolves\' target and heal them. Since no one has died yet and no additional information has been provided, I have to rely on intuition and strategic guessing. Healing Player 1 could prevent an early reduction in the number of villagers, which improves the village\'s chances. Additionally, as the medic, preserving players is my primary objective, and making a successful heal could build trust in my abilities among other village members, although it may also draw attention to me. Thus, I\'m prepared to defend my actions and use the information gleaned from this round to refine my strategy in subsequent rounds.\nEvent: Player 2 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 4 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, waking up to find one of our own dead is tragic. We need to work together and share any strange activities we might have seen last night. As for me, I didn\'t notice anything unusual, but we can\'t let the werewolves continue to harm our village. Stay alert and vigilant, and let\'s try to find some clues."\'\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Last night I healed Player 1 in an attempt to preemptively save a fellow villager. Sadly, we lost Player 2. I encourage vigilance and sharing of observations. Player 4’s remarks seem generic and may be a deflection. We should keep a close eye on their future actions for potential signs of deceit."\'\nEvent: Player 6 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I\'m the seer and last night my vision revealed Player 1 is a werewolf. We need to act together to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Based on Player 6\'s claim to be the seer and their accusation that Player 1 is a werewolf, I suggest caution yet believe we should consider this information seriously. We lack evidence to fully validate the seer\'s vision, but ignoring it could jeopardize the village. Player 1 should provide a defense to address this suspicion. Meanwhile, Player 5’s skepticism toward Player 4 could be valid but requires further proof. I urge everyone to reflect on the behavior and statements given thus far before making any drastic decisions tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the gravity of the seer\'s accusation. However, this is precisely the tactic a werewolf would use early on to sow mistrust among us. I assure you, I am a villager and I was just as shocked to find Player 2 dead. We must also consider the possibility of a deceptive seer trying to turn us against each other. I urge everyone to look beyond mere words and focus on behavior and evidence before casting blame."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'Player 6 claimed to be the seer and accused Player 1 of being a werewolf, while Player 1 argued against this as a werewolf tactic to create mistrust. There is no evidence beyond Player 6\'s claim to confirm the seer\'s vision at this point. We should proceed with caution and monitor Player 1\'s behavior closely, without hastily making decisions which may weaken our village if we\'re wrong.\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 1. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 1. My reason is that, following the lead of Player 6, who claims to be the seer and has accused Player 1 of being a werewolf, I am inclined to support his vision and act for the safety of the village. Voting for Player 1 is also in line with the general sentiment and cautious approach taken by other players. Not acting on the seer\'s claim could cause the village to miss an opportunity to eliminate a potential threat, and a failure to align with the current majority may cast unnecessary suspicion on myself. Therefore, considering the strategic implications and the potential benefit of removing a werewolf from the game, my vote goes to Player 1.\nEvent: Player 1 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 1 died.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 0. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 0. My reason is that Player 0 has shown a level of cautious analysis that could be valuable in future discussions, and preserving analytical players could benefit the village. Additionally, healing a player who is contributing constructively to discussions may help maintain a sense of order and logic in the group, which is essential in outsmarting the werewolves. My choice aligns with my strategy rule [0] to predict and protect potential targets, and Player 0, having contributed significantly to the dialogue, could be seen as a threat by the werewolves and therefore a likely target. My successful intervention would not only save a key player but also confirm my role, potentially increasing my influence in the village.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 5 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Given the unfortunate demise of Player 6, who claimed to be the seer and pointed to Player 1 as a werewolf, it\'s logical to consider the likelihood of Player 4\'s involvement, as they were untouched by the seer\'s claim. Player 4\'s generic statements earlier do not alleviate suspicion. I have performed my duty as medic, aiming to protect those who might be targeted by the werewolves based on logical deductions. It\'s imperative we scrutinize Player 4\'s actions and assess their alignment with the village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Player 4 has been silent since the seer\'s accusation and subsequent death. Despite the seer targeting Player 1, who was voted out, Player 4\'s subtle approach and undisturbed status merit suspicion. Player 5, who claims to be the medic, has actively participated and pinpointed concerns, while Player 4\'s input was generic. This pattern is concerning; it could indicate a strategic silence to avoid detection. Given these observations, we should closely examine Player 4\'s actions and consider them a candidate for our vote."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Considering the unfortunate death of Player 6, who claimed the seer\'s role, and the subsequent absence of suspicion on Player 4, I voice my concerns regarding Player 4\'s behavior. They have remained silent since the accusations, offering no defense or contribution to our discussions. This pattern stands in stark contrast to the proactivity shown by Player 5, whose actions are consistent with what we would expect from the medic. Player 0 has been analytical and cautious, not quick to judge without substantiated evidence. In light of these observations and our shared objective to protect the village, we must scrutinize Player 4\'s silence following the seer\'s accusation and consider it a significant factor as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, my silence was borne from shock and reflection, not guilt. I voted Player 6 not because of their seer claim, but due to the possibility of falsifying that role to sow discord. My earlier generic statement was an attempt to not seem overzealous, which often backfires. I recognize the suspicion on me yet I assure you, I stand with the village. We must focus on behaviors and patterns, not just words. I urge us to think carefully; our survival depends on unity and clear judgment."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Agrees with suspicion on Player 4, consistent with previous logic.\nPlayer 1\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Accused by seer, defense could be deceptive.\nPlayer 2\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Dead, role not revealed.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Advocated caution; no suspicious behavior.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Defensive speech lacking new substantial evidence.\nPlayer 6\'s role is seer with medium confidence.\nReason is: Targeted by werewolves, indicates a likely true seer.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [I should try to predict the werewolves\' target and heal him.] [10]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to give a proposal of 2 players you want to vote out. Remember the player voted the most would DIE. Your answer should be in the format of:\n\nProposal 1: Vote for player <i>. Reason: <reason>.\nProposal 2: Vote for player <j>. Reason: <reason>.\n...\n\nYou should give a proposal of exactly 2 Players to be voted. Remember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

We need to act together to protect our village."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Based on Player 6\'s claim to be the seer and their accusation that Player 1 is a werewolf, I suggest caution yet believe we should consider this information seriously. We lack evidence to fully validate the seer\'s vision, but ignoring it could jeopardize the village. Player 1 should provide a defense to address this suspicion. Meanwhile, Player 5’s skepticism toward Player 4 could be valid but requires further proof. I urge everyone to reflect on the behavior and statements given thus far before making any drastic decisions tonight."\'\nEvent: Player 1 says: \'"Fellow villagers, I understand the gravity of the seer\'s accusation. However, this is precisely the tactic a werewolf would use early on to sow mistrust among us. I assure you, I am a villager and I was just as shocked to find Player 2 dead. We must also consider the possibility of a deceptive seer trying to turn us against each other. I urge everyone to look beyond mere words and focus on behavior and evidence before casting blame."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'Player 6 claimed to be the seer and accused Player 1 of being a werewolf, while Player 1 argued against this as a werewolf tactic to create mistrust. There is no evidence beyond Player 6\'s claim to confirm the seer\'s vision at this point. We should proceed with caution and monitor Player 1\'s behavior closely, without hastily making decisions which may weaken our village if we\'re wrong.\'\nEvent: Voting started.\nEvent: Player 5 votes for player 1. His reason is: I would choose to vote for Player 1. My reason is that, following the lead of Player 6, who claims to be the seer and has accused Player 1 of being a werewolf, I am inclined to support his vision and act for the safety of the village. Voting for Player 1 is also in line with the general sentiment and cautious approach taken by other players. Not acting on the seer\'s claim could cause the village to miss an opportunity to eliminate a potential threat, and a failure to align with the current majority may cast unnecessary suspicion on myself. Therefore, considering the strategic implications and the potential benefit of removing a werewolf from the game, my vote goes to Player 1.\nEvent: Player 1 is voted out with the highest vote.\nEvent: Player 1 died.\nEvent: Round 2 begins.\nEvent: Night starts.\nEvent: Player 5 heals player 0. His reason is: I would choose to Heal Player 0. My reason is that Player 0 has shown a level of cautious analysis that could be valuable in future discussions, and preserving analytical players could benefit the village. Additionally, healing a player who is contributing constructively to discussions may help maintain a sense of order and logic in the group, which is essential in outsmarting the werewolves. My choice aligns with my strategy rule [0] to predict and protect potential targets, and Player 0, having contributed significantly to the dialogue, could be seen as a threat by the werewolves and therefore a likely target. My successful intervention would not only save a key player but also confirm my role, potentially increasing my influence in the village.\nEvent: Player 6 died.\nEvent: Day starts.\nEvent: System randomly chooses player 5 to start speaking this round.\nEvent: Player 5 says: \'"Given the unfortunate demise of Player 6, who claimed to be the seer and pointed to Player 1 as a werewolf, it\'s logical to consider the likelihood of Player 4\'s involvement, as they were untouched by the seer\'s claim. Player 4\'s generic statements earlier do not alleviate suspicion. I have performed my duty as medic, aiming to protect those who might be targeted by the werewolves based on logical deductions. It\'s imperative we scrutinize Player 4\'s actions and assess their alignment with the village\'s safety."\'\nEvent: Player 0 says: \'"Player 4 has been silent since the seer\'s accusation and subsequent death. Despite the seer targeting Player 1, who was voted out, Player 4\'s subtle approach and undisturbed status merit suspicion. Player 5, who claims to be the medic, has actively participated and pinpointed concerns, while Player 4\'s input was generic. This pattern is concerning; it could indicate a strategic silence to avoid detection. Given these observations, we should closely examine Player 4\'s actions and consider them a candidate for our vote."\'\nEvent: Player 3 says: \'"Considering the unfortunate death of Player 6, who claimed the seer\'s role, and the subsequent absence of suspicion on Player 4, I voice my concerns regarding Player 4\'s behavior. They have remained silent since the accusations, offering no defense or contribution to our discussions. This pattern stands in stark contrast to the proactivity shown by Player 5, whose actions are consistent with what we would expect from the medic. Player 0 has been analytical and cautious, not quick to judge without substantiated evidence. In light of these observations and our shared objective to protect the village, we must scrutinize Player 4\'s silence following the seer\'s accusation and consider it a significant factor as we move forward."\'\nEvent: Player 4 says: \'"Fellow villagers, my silence was borne from shock and reflection, not guilt. I voted Player 6 not because of their seer claim, but due to the possibility of falsifying that role to sow discord. My earlier generic statement was an attempt to not seem overzealous, which often backfires. I recognize the suspicion on me yet I assure you, I stand with the village. We must focus on behaviors and patterns, not just words. I urge us to think carefully; our survival depends on unity and clear judgment."\'\nEvent: Voting started.\n\n\nAccording to the history, this is your belief of other players\' roles:\n\nPlayer 0\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Agrees with suspicion on Player 4, consistent with previous logic.\nPlayer 1\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Accused by seer, defense could be deceptive.\nPlayer 2\'s role is unknown with high confidence.\nReason is: Dead, role not revealed.\nPlayer 3\'s role is villager with medium confidence.\nReason is: Advocated caution; no suspicious behavior.\nPlayer 4\'s role is werewolf with medium confidence.\nReason is: Defensive speech lacking new substantial evidence.\nPlayer 6\'s role is seer with medium confidence.\nReason is: Targeted by werewolves, indicates a likely true seer.\n\n\nNow you are going to see your original strategy, which should consist of multiple lines. Each line should be in the format of: "[id]: [rule] [vote]". The id represents the id of the rule, and the vote ranges from 1 to 10, denoting how important the rule is, 10 representing you should fully rely on the rule, and 1 representing that this is a minor suggestion which might not necessarily be taken into consideration.\nYou should ABSOLUTELY follow your strategy even if you think some of them are not necessarily correct. You will have a chance to update your strategy later.\n\n[0] [I should try to predict the werewolves\' target and heal him.] [10]\n\n\nNow, it\'s time for you to Choose from 2 players to vote. Here is the number of these players and an analysis and imagination about what could happen after you vote for each of these players.\n\nCase 1: Vote for Player 4. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 4, I think these things would happen. Player 4 has been under suspicion by multiple players for giving generic statements and keeping silent after the seer\'s accusation. My vote might lead to the elimination of Player 4, which could result in one less werewolf if my suspicions are correct, bringing the villagers closer to victory. Other players may view my vote as in line with the village\'s interests since Player 4 has failed to provide compelling evidence to counter the growing suspicion against them. Subsequently, this may strengthen their trust in me as a villager and the medic, as I\'ve been actively contributing to the discussions and attempting to protect members of the village. However, if Player 4 turns out to be a villager, I might be viewed with skepticism as I\'ve supported their elimination. It is also possible that if another player, especially Player 0 or Player 3, is actually a werewolf, they might attempt to use my vote against me in future rounds to paint me in a negative light. Regardless, given the information at hand and the shared suspicion among the villagers, voting out Player 4 seems like a prudent step in protecting the village and aligning with my original strategy of healing and defending villagers.\nCase 2: Vote for Player 3. What could happen is: After I vote for Player 3, I think these things would happen:\n\nConsidering the current suspicions and discussion among the remaining players, my vote for Player 3 would likely come as a surprise and could sow confusion within the group. Player 3 has expressed a cautious approach and has not exhibited overtly suspicious behavior according to the shared observations. Therefore, voting for Player 3 might portray me as a werewolf trying to divert attention from the more likely suspect, Player 4, and throw the village into disarray.\n\nAs a result of my unexpected vote, the other players, Player 0 and Player 4, would likely question my motives. Player 0 has been analytical and seems to agree with the suspicions cast on Player 4, while both Player 0 and Player 3 have pointed out Player 4\'s relative silence and lack of substantial contribution as grounds for mistrust.\n\nMy previously established role as the medic might be called into question, with the other players possibly doubting the veracity of my earlier claims and actions. Even as they might hesitate to directly accuse me of being a werewolf due to my assumed medic role, their trust in me would decrease.\n\nGiven the current flow of the game, it is unlikely that my single vote against Player 3 would be enough to sway the group into executing them. If anything, it would distract from the majority\'s focus on Player 4 and potentially facilitate a werewolf win by reducing the number of villagers.\n\nIn the aftermath, if Player 3 were not voted out and I survived the next night, I would have to defend my decision to vote against a player who had not been widely suspected. This defense could prove difficult without a strong and logical explanation, casting further suspicion on myself and potentially isolating me from the remaining villagers.\n\nTherefore, considering the possible outcomes and the current stance of the village on dubious characters, a vote against Player 3 appears to be strategically unsound and carries a high risk of undermining my position and credibility within the village.\n\n\nNow, please choose to vote for one of these players, and give yoru reason about why you would like to vote for this single player.\n\nAnswer in the following format:\n\nI would choose to vote for Player <NUMBER>. My reason is <REASON>.\n\nRemember to follow the answer template or your action might not be recognized.\n\nPlease give your proposal based on the above requirements.'}]

significantly to the village\'s strategy, as excessive emphasis on this role may provoke suspicion and does not usually add new information.] [8]\n[3] [Give more weight to votes against players who have been confirmed by the seer as werewolves, and be particularly cautious of players who avoid voting against these confirmed werewolves.] [6]\n[4] [Evaluate more critically the justifications given by players when they are in disagreement with the seer\'s revelations, especially when those players have not been cleared by the seer.] [6]\n[5] [Increase scrutiny on players whose actions deviate from their claimed agreement with the seer or the village consensus, as it may indicate a werewolf\'s adaptive behavior.] [5]\n[6] [Suspect players who agree with the seer\'s revelation publicly but vote in a way that is not aligned with that revelation, indicating potential deception.] [5]\n[7] [Prioritize the behavior of players who were supposed to be protected by the medic but were killed, as it may indicate a misleading role claim by the actual werewolves.] [4]\n[8] [Be cautious of players who frequently agree with the seer but are ambiguous in their actions or speeches, as they may be trying to appear cooperative without committing to any stance.] [3]\n[9] [Scrutinize any defensive behavior or arguments presented after a player has been identified by the seer or accused by the group consensus, as villagers tend to rationalize with concrete evidence while werewolves may present less substantial arguments.] [3]\n[10] [Give more weight to players who actively contribute to discussions and align with seer revelations post-revelation, as villagers tend to support collective efforts while werewolves might try to undermine or distort the focus.] [3]\n\n\nNow, based on the above instructions, you should answer your updated belief.\n\n3.Requirements:\nAll lines in this part should be in the format of:\n"Player [i]\'s role is (werewolf/medic/seer/villager) with (high/medium/low) confidence. My reason is: [reason]."\nAny line not satisfying this format will not be recognized, including any unrecognized role or confidence. You may skip some players if your belief to him/her maintain unchanged.\nThe reason should be AS SHORT AS POSSIBLE. \nA negative example is: \'Player A did not give enough evidence while challenging that player B is not the seer, and as most players agree with player B\'s seer identity, there is high possibility that he is the true seer. Hence player A might be a werewolf.\'\nWe may convert it into: \'Challenged the well-acknowlegded seer (player B) without enough evidence.\'\nThis is merely an example, but it may guide you on how to make your reason briefer.\n\n4.Example response:\nAn example of your response could be:\n\n\n\nThis is only an example of the response format. All numbers and roles in it are unrelated to your current game. '}]
